title: Cyber Security & Data Privacy

sections.title: Creating Secure Passwords
sections.content:
A good password protects your company account and professional data.

- **Strong Password**: A mix of letters (A, b), numbers (1, 2), and symbols (!, @).
- **Weak Password**: Easy to guess (e.g., '123456' or 'password').
- **Change your password**: Update it every few months for better security.
- **Don't share**: Keep your professional passwords secret.

sections.title: Digital Safety Habits
sections.content:
Stay safe at work with these habits:

- **2FA (Two-Factor Authentication)**: Using your password + a code from your phone or app.
- **Public Wi-Fi**: Do not access sensitive company data on free Wi-Fi in cafes or airports.
- **Lock your screen**: Always lock your computer when you leave your desk.
- **Phishing**: Be careful with strange emails or links that ask for your login details.

sections.title: How 2FA Works
sections.content:
```mermaid
graph TD
    A[Enter Password] --> B[Phone receives code]
    B --> C[Enter Code in System]
    C --> D{Identity Verified}
    D -- Yes --> E[Access Granted]
    D -- No --> F[Access Denied]
```

objectives: Recognize the difference between a strong and weak password
Understand the basic concept of 2FA for professional security
Identify safe digital habits (Locking screens, avoiding public Wi-Fi)
